main_definition: Collaboration is the act of working together with others to achieve a common goal, idea or project.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A joint effort where multiple parties work towards a shared objective.
meanings_and_examples.example: The collaboration between NASA and SpaceX has advanced space exploration significantly.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Cooperation among individuals or groups to complete tasks, solve problems, or create something new.
meanings_and_examples.example: In the medical research field, collaboration is essential for developing new treatments; a group of doctors and scientists often work together on this.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Synergistic effect when combined efforts produce results greater than those achieved by individual contributions alone.
meanings_and_examples.example: The success of the charity event was due to the collaboration among local businesses, volunteers, and community leaders.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A cooperative partnership in which individuals or entities share knowledge, resources, and responsibilities.
meanings_and_examples.example: Two artists collaborating on a painting combine their unique styles to create an innovative artwork.
